tool.name: OehLayersTool
tool.summary:
This tool adds OEH corporate layers to a selected map dataframe.

.. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. ..

Â© New South Wales Office of Environment and Heritage 2015. All Python scripts and associated documentation is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International (CC BY 4.0). The legal code for the licence is available at Creative Commons.

.. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. ..

New South Wales Office of Environment and Heritage does not represent or warrant that calculations performed by OEH Tools are accurate, correct, useful or meaningful, and does not accept any responsibility for the use of OEH Tools in either the form as supplied or as modified by others.

.. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. .. ..
tool.usage:
This tool exposes a number of OEH Corporate Layers available to add to mapping projects.

  • Open the tool

  • Select a target Dataframe from the drop-down list

  • Select one or more layers from the scrollable list

  • Run the tool

param.name: target_dataframe
param.dialogReference:
Drop-down list.

Select the dataframe to which you would like to add the layers.

param.name: available_layers

Scrollable list.

Select one or more layers to add to the target dataframe.

dataIdInfo.idCredit: Various GIS dudes, NSW Office of Environment & Heritage, September 2017.

This tool adds OEH corporate layers to a selected map dataframe.
